answers.answer: There should be nothing in your sons chart about your medical history that is not pertinant to your son, and this is not. Why not ask your GP why he felt it was important to include that information? You can also suggest to your GP that he/she educate themselves further about HCV and it's transmission. Yes, you can ask, and expect it to be removed.Evangaline

I actually asked that my Hep C status be put on my son's chart.  I do feel it is relevant to their medical history because it shows a potential exposure that should be known by the medical providers so they can keep their eyes open.  I feel it's just as relevant as a parent having cancer, diabetes, high blood pressure, etc.

question: Today my son had eye surgery.  I had a preop physical done on him and had it sent to the hospital.  while he was waiting to go into surgery the surgeon asked in front of the whole room about a remark on his chart.  Mother has active hepatitis C.  This information came from his general practioner.  Why?  My son does not have hepatitis C.  Why does this have to be on his chart?  Where does it stop? I do not want this tailing my 2 boys all there life.  Can i demand this be removed from there records.  Why wouldn't he put exposure to hepatitis C not mother
